title: Road Assessment and Monitoring
segmentation: Linda gentlemen, I'd like to tell you something about the activities of the lock Package Tour, Rd assessment and monitoring of.
Our work here.
Some works about the background, then some general information on the work package tool and very shortly about the three work packages.
A bit more about the first one because the second and third one will be delivered later on by my colleagues and some concluding.
Marksville at the end.
About the background.
The Expressway network in our agent in the Eastern and Central European region is below much below the old European Union countries.
Actually it is around 3rd third of it and that is one of the challenges for us to change at the same time there is a much poorer condition generally than in the.
The western part of the country.
It means that a lot of disadvantages can come from here in the national economy, extra user costs come from there.
The life Quality and Turin is suffer also, so it is needed to clear this quality backlog.
Let's say in Hungary we we have had.
We have worked out at 12 year program for that.
Actually.
The pavement management system is every countries need this kind of information.
We are speaking about performance related pavement monitoring is needed.
Mainly the uneven surface.

This has bearing capacity and schedule assistance as important condition parameters should be systematically measured and for that high speed and high performance measuring devices are needed and our activity tackled this kind of problems.
Among others speaking about the work package tool as I have mentioned, it had three work tasks, one of them dealing with the traffic equivalency factors.
I will pick a bit more about it.
One of them was.
The first one I've mentioned was led by Mr. Doukoku coat from the dog.
2nd of under Rd measuring techniques.
Actually the harmonization activity was led by Mr: spillover from the IIT.

If I old are not and the work package work, task three was on the systematic decision support for Rd rehabilitation and it was led by Slovenka handing banned from the DDC, Slovenia that is flow chart based methodology.
In this field that that was worked out here, some words about the traffic equivalency factors exercise.

Actually our goal was trying to workout at least to estimate the traffic load equivalency factors for pavement structures which are typical for the central and Eastern European countries or methodology.
What we followed taking into consideration the time constraint and limited.
Money in financial resources as well.
The HVS load the heavy vehicle simulator loads used another so called fatigue type exercise which will be presented to you later on.
We had a kind of complementary activity there.
Reaction type loading and this kind of value there were used.
Reactions to calculate these kind of these factors 6 basement structures were used in this exercise and four were considered as appropriate for our.
All work here.
You can see I will not speak about the details you will hear about more.
Is this 6?
Variants only mentioning the last one path as an important feature reinforced grid steel grid was used as.

Relatively new and and not very well researched material and the the consequences to the performance was an important things and in our case unfortunately it was not possible to include it because it is.
Behavior was basically different from the rest of.
The other ones in the Technic equivalency factor calculation.
Here you can see this.
Swedish device.
Which were used in this.
The goal at this phatic test, what I was mentioning the different sector was loaded.
In some cases an uniform load 60K Newton we load, but in other cases after having seen that there are, there is no sign of deterioration at higher load was used later on 80 and then 100.
It was very important for our our goal because we couldn't really use this kind of information in our traffic equivalency factor calculation.
It it made a lot of problems for us.
It could have been much.
Easier, of course it would it if it had been.
Yeah, you know.
Farm Lord here.
Of what we were doing in the first part and the last part of this fatigue tests to determine to perform this response test.
Several loads were used.
Thirty 4050 and 60K Newton and we have tried to determine the asphalt strains on the lowest level of the asphalt layers and this asphalt trains were used especially.
Back evolution as a function of of the loader position number to determine the critical repetition number.
The critical repetition number could have been calculated using a pavement design methodology.

We have selected the Slovenian one and these, both in formation, made it possible for us to to calculate the powers of will load ratio because, as it is unknown to you, this stuff equivalency factor actually.
The the connection between the higher and higher will load and the effect on the pavement deterioration.
Its effect in the actual Rd test it was supposed to be the force power, but in reality it was diff.
You can see and hear we had several results, but we have selected the ratios between the 40 and 50K.
Newton will load.

It is equal to 80 and 100 kilometers X load and these ratios came out for four sections and we think that there are preliminary results, but they seem to be acceptable, having considered the earlier similar activities.
In this field.
Then only some words about the other two work tasks and.
I'm sorry that the work package work tasks 2.2.
The harmonization of several devices for measuring bearing capacity, uneven Ness, killed resistance all over Europe, mainly in the central and Eastern European countries.
They had kind of harmonization exercise near Vienna and there.
I mean, repeatability and and appropriateness have been.
Estimated or determined based on the results.
The situation was relatively easy when kind of reference device could have been selected.
It was in the case of the unevenness measuring test.
Otherwise some some methodology which were more or less accepted in Europe used in this in this work and at the end a certificate was given to the participants.
Mr lunch.
Hopefully we'll speak more about it later on and the other work task is a systematic decision.
Support for rotor habilitation.
It is a decision-making methodology for the pavement rehabilitation and upgrading which is targeted to low volume roads.
And for the central and Eastern European country, that situation are reflected.
Here it is important to emphasize the low volume roads becausw.

In some countries there are similar methodology, but usually they are only for the motorways or or the high volume roads and flow flow chart based methodology worked out and this is actually a network level approach which should be followed by a project level one and several.
Case studies were.
Made here some conclusions.
We think that that the road assessment and monitoring.

Of course it is very important everywhere, but in our agent in the new Member States or Central and Eastern European region, especially of high importance and it is a very vital part of the asset management that I think the asset management is one of the main tasks to deal with for all of us and this kind of activity.
Helps in arranging some some goals here.
Yeah, how we can see this coordinated effort of mainly CCS expert who was really a success has been really successful and hopefully in the near future we will have.

Miller activities to continue this kind of activities and at the same time we would like to emphasize that the very important to consider contribution to success by Swedish and Austrian Express were very important there.
Experience could have been you.
Very well here.
Thank you for your kind attention.
